metadata.title: CVE-2019-11503 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: snap-confine as included in snapd before 2.39 did not guard against symlinkraces when performing the chdir() to the current working directory of thecalling user, aka a "cwd restore permission bypass."

criterions.comment: snapd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
